canonical_datasets.description: Citation dataset; structured dataset; from DeepMatcher, ER Benchmark, and Magellan data repository
canonical_datasets.processing: Initial labeled seed: 64 positive and 64 negative pairs sampled at random; default active learning with 10 rounds, labeling budget 128 per round

canonical_datasets.description: Citation dataset; structured dataset; from DeepMatcher, ER Benchmark, and Magellan data repository
canonical_datasets.processing: Initial labeled seed: 64 positive and 64 negative pairs sampled at random; default active learning with 10 rounds, labeling budget 128 per round

canonical_datasets.description: A text-based dataset comprising duplicate references to scientific publications; structured CSV version used.
Restaurant matching dataset from the Magellan repository for entity resolution.
Product dataset; structured dataset; from DeepMatcher, ER Benchmark, and Magellan data repository
canonical_datasets.processing: Schema from DeepMatcher used; initial labeled seed: 64 positive and 64 negative pairs sampled at random; default active learning with 10 rounds, labeling budget 128 per round

canonical_datasets.description: Restaurant dataset constructed by merging Restaurants 1 and 2 from Das et al. (2016); schemas differ slightly.
canonical_datasets.processing: Null value for zip code attribute in Restaurants 1 to avoid merging errors.

canonical_datasets.description: Contains descriptions of restaurants and their addresses from two different KBs; popular benchmark created by the Ontology Alignment Evaluation Initiative.
BeerAdvo-RateBeer; beer domain, structured ER benchmark
clean version of iTunes-Amazon; music domain, structured ER benchmark
Product dataset; textual dataset; from DeepMatcher, ER Benchmark, and Magellan data repository
canonical_datasets.processing: Initial labeled seed: 64 positive and 64 negative pairs sampled at random; CAND=20x|S| and k=20 for this dataset due to small |S|; default active learning with 10 rounds, labeling budget 128 per round

canonical_datasets.description: A dataset from the Alaska benchmark for entity matching.
An e-commerce product dataset collected from multiple websites.
Widely recognized for Dirty ER benchmarks.
Citation domain dataset containing bibliographic duplicates sourced from DBLP and Google Scholar.
Citation domain dataset containing bibliographic duplicates sourced from Citeseer and DBLP.
Music domain dataset including information from various platforms.
Music 20K dataset, used for Dirty ER benchmarks; large-scale variants up to 50K records.
Product dataset; structured dataset; from DeepMatcher, ER Benchmark, and Magellan data repository
canonical_datasets.processing: Schema from DeepMatcher used; initial labeled seed: 64 positive and 64 negative pairs sampled at random; default active learning with 10 rounds, labeling budget 128 per round

canonical_datasets.description: Contains descriptions of publications and their authors; matches between both publications and authors.
Contains descriptions of musicians, bands and their birthplaces, from BBCmusic and the BTC2012 version of DBpedia; highly heterogeneous schema and values.
Contains descriptions of movie-related entities (e.g., actors, directors, movies) from YAGO and IMDb; largest and most balanced KB pair.
Relational, heterogeneous schema entity matching dataset from Machamp
Semi-structured, homogeneous schema entity matching dataset from Machamp
Semi-structured, heterogeneous schema entity matching dataset from Machamp
Semi-structured and relational entity matching dataset from Machamp
Semi-structured and textual entity matching dataset (category) from Machamp
Semi-structured and textual entity matching dataset (word) from Machamp
Relational and textual entity matching dataset from Machamp
Geospatial heterogeneous entity matching dataset
Textual version derived from structured Amazon-Google dataset with 2-3 textual blob attributes.
Private dataset for entity matching.
Big Citations: blocks two tables of 2.5M and 1.8M paper citations, with complete gold.
Music Brainz: blocks a table of 20M songs (against itself), with complete gold.
Web Data Commons: blocks a table of 26M product descriptions; lacks complete gold.

Multilingual entity matching dataset (English-German subset) from [26], originally proposed for machine translation of structured data; each element is a string in English or German (with HTML/XML tags)
canonical_datasets.processing: English-Deutsch subset; initial labeled seed: 64 positive and 64 negative pairs sampled at random; test set constructed similarly; uses multilingual BERT as base

canonical_datasets.description: Matches movies and TV series extracted from IMDB and TheMovieDB [19]
Matches movies and TV series extracted from IMDB and TheTVDB [19]
Matches movies and TV series extracted from TheMovieDB and TheTVDB [19]
Matches information about films extracted from imdb.com and dbpedia.org [21]
Well-recognized benchmark for entity alignment, containing three smaller subsets for cross-lingual EA, each with 15,000 aligned entity pairs.
Comprises two subsets of a medium scale for monolingual EA, each including 100,000 aligned entity pairs and around one million triples.
Large EA benchmark with two cross-lingual subsets, each with over one million entities and nearly ten million triples.
Large-scale, complex, and cross-domain text-to-SQL dataset; 10,181 questions, 5,693 unique SQL queries, over 200 databases across 138 domains.
31,516 rows of police officer data; uses the 'Title' column with 154 distinct values (99 standard, 55 modified forms)

405,543 rows of medical data relating to disease; each row stores a medical term with standard and modified forms; many acronyms and abbreviations but not misspellings; evaluated on a 30,000 row sample
Subset of Large Disease; includes 634 disease names; pairs of standard and modified disease names
Dataset including location names (e.g., street and city names); ground truth contains 116 pairs of standard and modified names referring to the same location
Real-world dirty EM dataset; contains noise such as misspellings, missing values, incorrect entries

canonical_baselines.description: Deep learning model for entity resolution using deepmatcher library.
Active learning framework with deep models (random initialization).
Non-deep learning baseline using SVM algorithm from Magellan package.
Non-deep learning baseline from Magellan package.
Ensemble of 20 decision trees using learner-aware Query By Committee (QBC); strong active learning baseline for entity resolution
Non-deep learning baseline from Magellan package.
Non-deep learning baseline from Magellan package.
Non-deep learning baseline from Magellan package.
State-of-the-art deep learning method for entity resolution.
Supervised ER model; fine-tunes a pre-trained language model for sentence-pair classification.
Dual-objective BERT model combining binary matching and multi-class classification for entity matching.
Robust PLM-based ER method addressing data imbalance with modifications to enhance PLMs.
LLM-based ER (GPT-3) using manually designed prompts and demonstrations; standard prompting.
DeepMatcher+, a reference DL-based EM approach that does not rely on a transformer architecture.
Unsupervised, generative ER approach using Gaussian Mixture Models
Unsupervised, learns local embeddings for ER based on attribute-centric graphs
Supervised, integrates schematic and structural information with GNN for ER
Supervised, uses attention mechanism in sequence-based model for ER
Supervised, generative adversarial network for label augmentation in ER
DITTO using pseudo labels generated by CollaborER's ALG
Unsupervised framework that constructs rule-based pseudo labels and combines graph and sentence features.
Iterative active-learning-based entity matching method allocating annotation budget to informative pairs.
DITTO trained with the full training data of the processed Magellan datasets.
Large language model (65B) with 10-shot in-context learning.
Large language model (175B parameters) with 10-shot in-context learning.
Pre-trained SBERT used as a blocker.
Blocker baseline for candidate generation.
Blocker baseline for candidate generation.
LLM-based ER method employing traditional blocking and iterative partition scoring.
Batch-Questioning: Batches pairwise match questions into a single prompt for LLMs.
Clustering-based design that filters irrelevant pairs and uses LLM to cluster ambiguous cases.
Entity matching framework using RNNs to aggregate attribute values
Fine-tuned for entity matching as a sequence pair classification task
Finetunes TPLM and a SentenceBERT-like classifier on labeled data to obtain embeddings for similarity search; RoBERTa transformer used in this work
Transfer learning-based EM framework via domain adaptation
Meta-learning framework for data selection/weighting to better fine-tune LMs
Unsupervised approach using graph creation and random walk for structured/text data
TDmatch embeddings with an MLP classifier in supervised setting
Deep learning (DL) based blocker; one of the two best DL blockers.
Deep learning based blocker; one of the two best DL blockers.
Combination of the best DL blocker and RBB, a SOTA industrial blocker.
SOTA hash blocker from JedAI open-source platform.
SOTA hash blocker from JedAI open-source platform.
SOTA hash blocker from JedAI open-source platform.
kNN blocker using cosine similarity over 5-gram tokenization.
kNN blocker using Jaccard similarity over 3-gram and 5-gram tokenization.
Binary classifier for weight-based supervised meta-blocking
Cardinality-based pruning algorithm
Cardinality-based pruning algorithm
Original supervised meta-blocking framework using BCI and CNP with the feature set proposed in [25]
Non-adaptive blocking: candidate set via similarity search on pretrained TPLM embeddings; no task-specific finetuning
Embeddings from TPLM as finetuned by the matcher in paired mode; candidate set created as in PairedFixed
Blocking based on hand-crafted rules (human-designed), applied to five benchmark datasets
JedAI toolkit schema-based pipeline; similarity joins for blocking; best configuration per [47]
JedAI toolkit schema-agnostic pipeline; leverages all attributes to extract overlapping blocks; best configuration per [47]
Non-adaptive blocking for MultiLingual dataset; candidate set via similarity search on pretrained multilingual BERT embeddings
Adaptive blocking for MultiLingual dataset; embeddings from multilingual BERT as finetuned by the matcher in paired mode
State-of-the-art entity resolution method.
State-of-the-art entity resolution method.
State-of-the-art entity resolution method.
State-of-the-art entity resolution method.
Blocking Scheme Learner; learns a blocker from labeled data
State-of-the-art industrial non-DL solution that uses labeled data to learn a blocker
Token Blocking; unsupervised schema-agnostic approach
DL method that learns tuple embeddings using labeled data and LSH for retrieval
Existing DL solution for blocking
Existing DL solution; marginally uses DL to improve a non-DL blocking solution
Baseline text-to-SQL model using schema linking via string matching.
Graphix-base model with TransE-based schema linking.
Graphix-base model with GCN-based schema linking.
Edit distance metric for string similarity
Edit distance metric with different penalties for gaps
Tokenizes strings into sets of words and computes the Jaccard score
Creates n-grams (3-grams) for strings and computes Jaccard score over n-gram sets
Synonym rules-based approach for string matching
Set similarity approach using a bipartite graph; similarity is minimal sum of edge weights divided by number of edges; edge weights evaluated with Jaccard-NG
Large language model-based approach to string matching

canoncial_metrics.description: Proportion of predicted matches that are correct.
Proportion of ground truth matches that are correctly predicted.
Harmonic mean of precision and recall.
Monetary cost for API calls to LLMs, measured in US dollars.
Monetary cost for labeling entity pairs to prepare demonstrations, estimated from crowdsourcing rates.
Proportion of correctly clustered records according to the ground truth clusters.
canoncial_metrics.formulation: \mathrm{ACC}=\frac{\text { CorrectCount }}{|\Re|} \quad \text { CorrectCount }=\sum_{X_{j} \in \mathbb{X}} \sum_{x \in X_{j}} \mathbb{I}(\exists y \in M_{j}^{\prime}, y=x)

canoncial_metrics.description: Harmonic mean of purity and inverse-purity, evaluating clustering homogeneity and stability.
Ratio of candidate pairs output by the blocker to all possible pairs, $CSSR=|C| /|A \times B|$.
Fraction of correct entities ranked at position 1.
Fraction of correct entities ranked within top 10.
Mean Reciprocal Rank; average of reciprocal ranks for correct entities.
Measures whether the predicted SQL exactly matches the ground truth.
Measures whether the execution result of the predicted SQL matches the ground truth.
